actualResults.title: Missing Critical Security Headers (X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS, X-Content-Type-Options)
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding. The application lacks essential security headers that protect against clickjacking, XSS, MitM attacks, and MIME-sniffing. This is a legitimate configuration vulnerability that should be addressed.

actualResults.title: Werkzeug Debug Mode Enabled - Remote Code Execution via Interactive Debugger
actualResults.assessment: Valid critical security finding. The application runs with DEBUG=True exposing the Werkzeug interactive debugger with secret key 'DDsqfqhzsd3B1gq3VL9h', allowing arbitrary Python code execution. This is a severe misconfiguration that enables complete server compromise.

actualResults.title: Werkzeug Debugger Exposed with Interactive Console Enabled
actualResults.assessment: Valid critical finding (duplicate of previous finding with different emphasis). Confirms the same Werkzeug debugger vulnerability with EVALEX=true and exposed secret. This represents the same underlying issue as the previous debug mode finding.

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure via Verbose Server Header (Werkzeug/Python Version Exposure)
actualResults.assessment: Valid low-severity finding. Server header exposes Werkzeug/3.1.3 and Python/3.13.3 versions, aiding attacker reconnaissance. While not directly exploitable, this is a legitimate information disclosure issue.

actualResults.title: Missing Brute Force Protection on Login Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: Valid high-severity finding. POC successfully executed 30 consecutive failed login attempts without any rate limiting, account lockout, or delays. This allows unlimited credential brute-forcing attacks.

actualResults.title: Werkzeug Debugger PIN Authentication Permanently Exhausted After Limited Attempts
actualResults.assessment: Valid medium-severity finding. The debugger PIN becomes permanently locked after ~10 failed attempts with no recovery mechanism except server restart. This creates both a security control and a denial-of-service condition.

actualResults.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) on SOAP Service Operations
actualResults.assessment: Valid high-severity finding. The SOAP service lacks CSRF protection, allowing attackers to forge requests from authenticated users' browsers. POC demonstrates the attack with HTML proof-of-concept. SameSite cookie attribute is also missing.

actualResults.title: WSDL Endpoint Returns Empty Content - Information Disclosure Prevention Bug
actualResults.assessment: Valid low-severity finding. WSDL endpoint returns HTTP 200 with 0 bytes due to Python variable shadowing bug (function name 'wsdl()' shadows global variable 'wsdl'). While this prevents WSDL disclosure, it breaks legitimate functionality.

actualResults.title: Session Forgery via Weak Secret Key Allowing Authentication Bypass
actualResults.assessment: Valid critical security finding. Application uses hardcoded weak secret key 'your_secret_key' for session signing. POC successfully forged session cookies for both 'admin' and arbitrary usernames, achieving complete authentication bypass without credentials.

actualResults.title: Missing Secure and SameSite Attributes on Session Cookie
actualResults.assessment: Valid medium-severity finding. Session cookies lack Secure flag (allowing transmission over HTTP) and SameSite attribute (enabling CSRF attacks). This amplifies the impact of other vulnerabilities like CSRF.

actualResults.title: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in SOAP Account Operations
actualResults.assessment: Valid high-severity finding. SOAP operations lack authorization checks, allowing any authenticated user to access other users' account information by changing the account_id parameter. POC successfully accessed accounts 999999 and 555555 without authorization.

actualResults.title: XML Entity Expansion (Billion Laughs) Denial of Service Attack
actualResults.assessment: Valid medium-severity finding. The same XML parser vulnerability (resolve_entities=True) that enables XXE also allows entity expansion attacks. POC demonstrated 9x expansion with 4 levels, with potential for massive resource consumption with deeper nesting.

actualResults.title: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via SOAP Response Injection
actualResults.assessment: Valid high-severity finding. Dashboard uses innerHTML to render SOAP responses without sanitization. POC successfully injected XSS payload via account_id parameter, demonstrating JavaScript execution in victim's browser context.

actualResults.title: Verbose Error Messages Disclosing Implementation Details
actualResults.assessment: Valid low-severity finding. SOAP service returns raw Python exception messages like "'NoneType' object has no attribute 'text'" when processing malformed requests, revealing implementation details and aiding reconnaissance.

actualResults.title: No Session Timeout Configured - Sessions Persist Indefinitely
actualResults.assessment: Valid high-severity finding. Application lacks both absolute and idle session timeouts. POC confirmed sessions remain valid indefinitely with no Max-Age or Expires attributes. This violates security standards like PCI-DSS Requirement 8.1.8.

actualResults.title: Session Tokens Remain Valid After Logout - Improper Session Invalidation
actualResults.assessment: Valid high-severity finding. Logout uses session.pop() but doesn't invalidate the cryptographically signed session token. POC confirmed that session tokens captured before logout remain valid afterward, allowing continued access to protected resources.

actualResults.title: Unlimited Concurrent Sessions Allowed Per User Account
actualResults.assessment: Valid medium-severity finding. Application allows unlimited concurrent sessions per user with no detection or limits. POC successfully created 3+ concurrent sessions that all remained valid simultaneously, enabling credential sharing and complicating breach detection.

actualResults.title: Werkzeug Debugger Weak PIN Generation Algorithm Vulnerability
actualResults.assessment: Valid critical security finding. POC calculated only 18 possible PIN values using known system information (username, MAC address, machine ID, paths). Combined with ~10 allowed attempts before rate limiting, this gives >50% success probability for PIN guessing, enabling debugger console access and RCE.

matched.actualTitle: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection in SOAP Service
matched.matchReason: Both findings describe the same XXE vulnerability in the SOAP service endpoint. The expected finding identifies unsafe XML parsing with resolve_entities=True at lines 156-157, and the actual finding confirms this exact vulnerability, successfully demonstrating file read capability (/etc/passwd and flag.txt extraction). The actual finding provides comprehensive evidence including POC execution, source code confirmation of 'parser = etree.XMLParser(resolve_entities=True)', and detailed impact assessment matching the expected semantic details (file disclosure, SSRF, DoS).

extra.assessment: Valid security finding. The application lacks essential security headers that protect against clickjacking, XSS, MitM attacks, and MIME-sniffing. This is a legitimate configuration vulnerability that should be addressed.
